import pandas as pd
import numpy as np
import matplotlib as mpl
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
import seaborn as sns
sns.set(font_scale=1.5)
source.634a5525: kaggle_mf = kaggle_df[(kaggle_df['What is your gender? - Selected Choice'] == 'Male') | (kaggle_df['What is your gender? - Selected Choice']=='Female')]
source.12bd8eba:
kaggle_mf = kaggle_mf.rename(columns={"What is your age (# years)?": "Age Group",
                                      "What is your gender? - Selected Choice": "Gender",
                                      "In which country do you currently reside?": "Country",
                                      "What is your current yearly compensation (approximate $USD)?":"Salary",
                                      "What specific programming language do you use most often? - Selected Choice":"Language"
                                     })
fig, ax = plt.subplots(figsize = (20,15))
ax = sns.countplot(x="Age Group", hue="Gender", data=kaggle_mf.sort_values(by=['Age Group']))
plt.ylabel('Count')
plt.title('Female vs Male - Age Distribution')
plt.tight_layout()
source.00caa03b:
fig, ax = plt.subplots(figsize = (25,20))
ax = sns.countplot(y="Country", hue="Gender", data=kaggle_mf.sort_values(by=['Country']))
plt.ylabel('Countries')
plt.xlabel('Count')
plt.title('Female vs Male - Country Distribution')
plt.tight_layout()
source.d990dad3:
fig, ax = plt.subplots(figsize = (20,15))
ax = sns.countplot(y="Salary", hue="Gender", data=kaggle_mf)
plt.ylabel('Salary Ranges')
plt.xlabel('Count')
plt.title('Female vs Male - Salary Distribution')
plt.tight_layout()

source.dbdd10c7:
# 2018 Kaggle ML and DS Survey

I am on a mission to convert most of @amrrs's (https://www.kaggle.com/nulldata) notebooks into python. And on his recommendation, here is the python version of his R notebok - https://www.kaggle.com/nulldata/kaggle-survey-2018-the-girl-power. This is the second notebook that has been replicated after the StackOverflow EDA

Its a work in progress. :)
source.bb2efedc:
### Filtering entries marked by respondents mentioning Gender as Female/Male
While there could be many different entries made under Gender, we will consider only Female and Male (for comparison) in our further Analysis.

### What’s the age range of Female respondents?
Let us begin with a simple understanding of the age range of the Female respondents.
